Instance.description: Tunable structure holding all relevant information for a Perk bought with a type of Bucks.

TunableEnum.name: associated_bucks_type
TunableEnum.description: The type of Bucks required to unlock this Perk.

TdescFragTag.name: available_for_puchase_tests
TdescFragTag.description: A set of tests that must pass in order for this perk to be available for purchase. This is enforced on the UI side. If the tests returns False then we will mark the perk as locked and pass along a tooltip, the one from the failed test. For the tooltip the first token is the Sim attempting to unlock the perk.

TunableList.name: buffs_to_award
TunableList.description: A list of references to buffs to add to the owner of bucks tracker this perk is unlocked in and optional reason for the buffs.

TunableTuple.description: A pair of Buff and Reason for the buff.

TunableVariant.name: buff_reason
TunableVariant.description: If set, specify a reason why the buff was added.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The reason the buff was added. This will be displayed in the buff tooltip.

TunableVariant.name: buff_source
TunableVariant.description: The tuning file that applied this buff. This is typically tuned to be the same file that this buff is being tuned on. This is NOT player facing, and is used for telemetry only.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: The tuning file that applied this buff. This is typically tuned to be the same file that this buff is being tuned on. This is NOT player facing, and is used for telemetry only.

Tunable.name: buff_type
Tunable.description: Buff that will get added to sim.

TunableList.name: conflicting_perks
TunableList.description: A list of perks that this perk is mutually exclusive with. When a perk is mutually exclusive with another perk it means that the perk cannot be purchased if that perk has already been purchased.

Tunable.description: A reference to a perk that this perk is mutually exclusive with.

Tunable.name: display_name
Tunable.description: This Perk's display name. No expected arguments.

TunableTuple.name: icon
TunableTuple.description: The icon image to be displayed.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableList.name: linked_perks
TunableList.description: A list of Perks that will be unlocked along with this one if not already unlocked.

TunableVariant.name: lock_on_purchase
TunableVariant.description: A list of perks to lock when this perk is purchased.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: List of perks to lock when this perk is unlocked.

Tunable.description: Reference to a bucks perk that must be locked.

TunableList.name: loots_on_lock
TunableList.description: A list of loots to award when this perk is Locked.

Tunable.description: A loot to be applied. Actor is the Sim that the Perk is being locked for.

TunableList.name: loots_on_unlock
TunableList.description: A list of loots to award when this perk is Unlocked.

Tunable.description: A loot to be applied. Actor is the Sim that the perk is being unlocked for.

Tunable.name: next_level_perk
Tunable.description: The next perk within this particular chain of perks. If tunable is None, then it either does not belong to a chain or is the last in the chain.

Tunable.name: perk_description
Tunable.description: The description for this Perk. No expected arguments.

TunableVariant.name: progression_statistic
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this ranked statistic tracks the progress towards unlocking this perk. This statistic should tune an AwardPerkLoot in its event data with the ability to award this perk. Use an AwardPerkLoot with the progress strategy to give progress to obtaining the perk.

TunableVariant.name: required_unlocks
TunableVariant.description: A list of all of the bucks perks that must be unlocked for this one to be available for purchase.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: List of required perks for this perk to be available.

Tunable.description: Reference to a bucks perk that must be unlocked.

TunableList.name: rewards
TunableList.description: A list of rewards to grant the household when this Perk is unlocked.

TunableVariant.description: A single specific reward.

TunableTuple.name: additional_business_customer_count
TunableTuple.description: A reward that unlocks increments in the customer countfor a business type.

TunableEnum.name: business_type
TunableEnum.description: The business type to which this reward should be given.

Tunable.name: customer_count_increment
Tunable.description: The amount to increment the customer count for the tuned business type. You can also use this to decrement the customer count but the code will never allow a negative customer count or the sim cap to be violated. This change is permanent across all business types so use with caution!

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications. e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableTuple.name: additional_business_markup
TunableTuple.description: A reward that unlocks increments in the markup multiplier for a business type.

TunableEnum.name: business_type
TunableEnum.description: The business type to which this reward should be given.

Tunable.name: markup_increment
Tunable.description: The amount to increment the markup multiplier for the tuned business type. You can also use the to decrement the markup multiplier but the code will never allow a negative multiplier. This change is permanent across all business types so use with caution!

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications. e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableTuple.name: additional_employee_slot
TunableTuple.description: A reward that unlocks an additional employee slot for the entire household's businesses.

TunableEnum.name: business_type
TunableEnum.description: The business type to which this reward should be given.

TunableEnum.name: employee_type
TunableEnum.description: The employee type to increment the slot count.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications. e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableTuple.name: bucks
TunableTuple.description: A reward that gives the specified bucks.

Tunable.name: amount
Tunable.description: The amount of Bucks to award. Must be a positive value.

TunableEnum.name: bucks_type
TunableEnum.description: The type of Bucks to grant.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications. e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableTuple.name: buff
TunableTuple.description: A tunable buff to be given to a single Sim or all Sims in a household as a reward.

TunableTuple.name: buff
TunableTuple.description: Buff to be given as a reward.

TunableVariant.name: buff_reason
TunableVariant.description: If set, specify a reason why the buff was added.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The reason the buff was added. This will be displayed in the buff tooltip.

TunableVariant.name: buff_source
TunableVariant.description: The tuning file that applied this buff. This is typically tuned to be the same file that this buff is being tuned on. This is NOT player facing, and is used for telemetry only.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: The tuning file that applied this buff. This is typically tuned to be the same file that this buff is being tuned on. This is NOT player facing, and is used for telemetry only.

Tunable.name: buff_type
Tunable.description: Buff that will get added to sim.

TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableTuple.name: build_buy_magazine_collection
TunableTuple.description: A tunable magazine collection that a Sim/household will have access to in build/buy.

Tunable.name: magazine_collection
Tunable.description: Unlock a magazine room to purchase in build/buy.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableTuple.name: build_buy_object
TunableTuple.description: A tunable object definition that a Sim/household will have access to in build/buy.

Tunable.name: object_definition
Tunable.description: The definition of the object to be created.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableTuple.name: cas_part
TunableTuple.description: A tunable CAS part to be given to a Sim.

Tunable.name: cas_part
Tunable.description: The cas part for this reward.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. TunableTuple.name: display_text
TunableTuple.description: No reward. Only useful for supplying display text.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. TunableTuple.name: dynasty_prestige
TunableTuple.description: A tunable amount of Dynasty Prestige to be given to a single Sim or all Sims in a household as a reward.

Tunable.name: amount
Tunable.description: The amount of individual prestige awarded to the sim or household.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. TunableTuple.name: money
TunableTuple.description: A tunable simoleon amount to be given as a reward.

TunableVariant.name: money
TunableVariant.description: Give money to a sim/household.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A literal value that is to be used as the lower and upper bound of an interval. This allows both literal and range interval tunings in the same TunableVariant without having to manually set the lower and upper bounds to the same value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The upper and lower bounds.

TunableTuple.name: random_in_range
TunableTuple.description: A tunable interval between lower_bound and upper_bound.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableTuple.name: object_definition
TunableTuple.description: A tunable object to be put in a sim/household inventory.

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: Give an object as a reward.

TunableTuple.name: set_club_gathering_vibe
TunableTuple.description: A reward that sets the specified club vibe.

TunableEnum.name: vibe_to_set
TunableEnum.description: The vibe that the club gathering will be set to.

TunableTuple.name: trait
TunableTuple.description: A tunable trait to be given to a sim.

Tunable.name: trait
Tunable.description: Give a trait as a reward

TunableTuple.name: whim_bucks
TunableTuple.description: A tunable number of whim bucks to be given to a single Sim or all Sims in a household as a reward.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. Tunable.name: whim_bucks
Tunable.description: The number of whim bucks to give.

TunableVariant.name: temporary_perk_information
TunableVariant.description: Tunables associated with temporary Perks.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Tunables associated with temporary Perks.

Tunable.name: duration
Tunable.description: The tunable number of Sim hours this Perk should last for, if temporary.

TunableVariant.name: unlocked_tooltip
TunableVariant.description: A tooltip that will be shown on this Perk when unlocked so the user knows when they will be able to buy it again. No expected arguments.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A tooltip that will be shown on this Perk when unlocked so the user knows when they will be able to buy it again. No expected arguments.

TunableList.name: traits_to_award
TunableList.description: A list of references to traits to add to the owner of bucks tracker this perk is unlocked on. Traits will be removed when the perk is locked.

Tunable.description: A reference to a trait to be awarded.

TunableList.name: ui_display_flags
TunableList.description: The display flags for this Perk in the Perks Panel UI. LINK_TOP: Display a line connecting this perk to the perk above it

TunableVariant.name: undiscovered_description
TunableVariant.description: When enabled will cause a different description to be displayed if the Perk has never been acquired by the Sim.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The description for this perk when it has never been acquired by this Sim.

Tunable.name: unlock_cost
Tunable.description: How many Bucks of the specified type this Perk costs to unlock.
